section.name: Jadabs Applications
section.p: This document shows the application of Jadabs and its services.

tr.td: The well known Lego-Mindstorms have also found an application in our research. As a basis the robots are independent vehicles. By adding new services or changing service the robots can be adapted to perform more logic espacially when more robots are in their communication range and coordination is needed.

A device like a PDA or mobile phone has already at least two communication possibilities like Wireless Lan, Bluetooth, GMS, infrared, etc. The problem is now that once one communication does not work we can not just switch to another one. We need to setup new connections and maybe we can't even use the same connection layer like IP. By changing the configuration and reconfiguring the environment of such devices dynamically we are able to keep connections open on higher layers.
We have given these projects as laboratory assignments to many groups.

section.name: Mindstorms-Robots
section.p: In the Mindstorms Lab students get several robots built out of Lego Mindstorms kit. The robot contains an iPAQ as its brain to allow autonomous movements. As such the robot can be started to fullfill a basic task, for example moving randomly a grid.

The goal of this lab is to extend the robot with new behaviour without to restart the whole robot application. Image two robots are moving on this grid and you want to connect that one robot follows the other. The second robot would therefore get a slave extension which allways copies the movements from the master robot. Jadabs allows to put new extensions into the system. By using Prose, a dynamic AOP system, it is also possible to crosscut the running application at different points to execute specific additional behaviour.

section.name: Multi-Homing
section.p: During the PDA Bluetooth/WLan lab students use the Jadabs framework to switch from Bluetooth to Wireless connections, depending on the common sense. The students have to explore the possibilities of this framework and to write an application. An application has to detect the other PDAs, and upload extensions to the other PDAs to get a common layer of knowledge, like using Bluetooth for all or using one node as a bridge between the two different infrastructurs.
